title: Quantifiers
description: Слушайте и определяйте количество с помощью квантификаторов.

tasks.audioText: I went to the supermarket today. There were only a few apples left on the shelf.
tasks.transcript: There were only a few apples left on the shelf.

options.text: A small number of apples remained on the shelf.
There were plenty of apples available.
No apples were on the shelf at all.
The shelf was full of different fruits.

tasks.explanation: 'A few' means a small number but not zero. Only a few = very small number.

tasks.audioText: Can you help me with this recipe? I need a little butter for the sauce.
tasks.transcript: I need a little butter for the sauce.

options.text: I need a large amount of butter.
I need a small amount of butter for the sauce.
I do not need any butter at all.
I need butter and oil in equal amounts.

tasks.explanation: 'A little' is used with uncountable nouns and means a small amount, but enough.

tasks.audioText: The conference was very popular this year. Several hundred people attended the event.
tasks.transcript: Several hundred people attended the event.

options.text: Only about ten people came to the event.
Nobody attended the conference.
A large number of people, in the hundreds, attended.
Exactly one hundred people were at the event.

tasks.explanation: 'Several hundred' means more than two or three hundred — a significant number of attendees.

tasks.audioText: Don't worry about the picnic. We have plenty of food for everyone.
tasks.transcript: We have plenty of food for everyone.

options.text: There is more than enough food for all the guests.
There is barely any food left for the picnic.
We need to buy more food right away.
We have food for only two people.

tasks.explanation: 'Plenty of' means more than enough — there is no need to worry about the quantity.

tasks.audioText: The doctor told me to change my diet. I eat too much sugar every day.
tasks.transcript: I eat too much sugar every day.

options.text: I eat a healthy amount of sugar.
I eat an excessive amount of sugar daily.
I never eat sugar at all.
I only eat sugar on weekends.

tasks.explanation: 'Too much' means more than is good or necessary. Sugar is uncountable, so we use 'too much'.

tasks.audioText: I tried to park near the shopping centre. There were too many cars in the car park.
tasks.transcript: There were too many cars in the car park.

options.text: The car park was almost empty.
There were just enough parking spaces.
The car park was overcrowded with vehicles.
Only a few cars were parked there.

tasks.explanation: 'Too many' is used with countable nouns and means an excessive number — more than the space allows.

tasks.audioText: I checked the fridge this morning. We don't have enough milk for breakfast.
tasks.transcript: We don't have enough milk for breakfast.

options.text: We have more milk than we need.
The amount of milk is insufficient for breakfast.
We have exactly the right amount of milk.
We never drink milk at breakfast.

tasks.explanation: 'Not enough' means less than is needed — the milk is insufficient for the meal.

tasks.audioText: How was the beach last weekend? There were hardly any people there because of the cold weather.
tasks.transcript: There were hardly any people there because of the cold weather.

options.text: The beach was very crowded last weekend.
Almost nobody was at the beach due to the cold.
Everyone enjoyed the warm weather at the beach.
Many families visited the beach despite the cold.

tasks.explanation: 'Hardly any' means almost none — very few people were there because it was cold.

tasks.audioText: The teacher was disappointed with the class. Very few students completed the homework.
tasks.transcript: Very few students completed the homework.

options.text: All students finished the homework on time.
Most of the class submitted their homework.
Only a very small number of students did the homework.
The teacher did not assign any homework.

tasks.explanation: 'Very few' means almost none — a disappointingly small number of students completed the task.

tasks.audioText: We had a great time at the party last night. Most of the guests stayed until midnight.
tasks.transcript: Most of the guests stayed until midnight.

options.text: The majority of guests remained at the party until midnight.
All the guests left before midnight.
Only one or two guests came to the party.
None of the guests enjoyed the party.

tasks.explanation: 'Most of' means the majority — more than half of the guests stayed late.

tasks.audioText: I looked in my wallet after shopping. I had very little money left after paying for everything.
tasks.transcript: I had very little money left after paying for everything.

options.text: I still had a lot of money after shopping.
I spent nothing at the shops.
Almost no money remained in my wallet after shopping.
I had exactly enough money for another shopping trip.

tasks.explanation: 'Very little' with uncountable nouns means almost none — an extremely small amount of money was left.

tasks.audioText: Our team is growing quickly. We have hired several new employees this month.
tasks.transcript: We have hired several new employees this month.

options.text: We hired exactly one new person this month.
We have not hired anyone recently.
We fired several employees this month.
We hired more than two but not a huge number of new people.

tasks.explanation: 'Several' means more than two or three but not a very large number — a moderate quantity.

tasks.audioText: My grandmother has a beautiful garden. She grows all kinds of flowers and vegetables.
tasks.transcript: She grows all kinds of flowers and vegetables.

options.text: She grows only roses in her garden.
She grows a wide variety of flowers and vegetables.
She does not grow anything in her garden.
She only grows vegetables, not flowers.

tasks.explanation: 'All kinds of' means many different types — a great variety of plants in the garden.

tasks.audioText: I've been saving for months. I finally have enough money to buy a new laptop.
tasks.transcript: I finally have enough money to buy a new laptop.

options.text: I still do not have the money I need for a laptop.
I have saved the necessary amount and can now buy the laptop.
I decided not to buy a laptop anymore.
I have too much money and don't know what to buy.

tasks.explanation: 'Enough' means the sufficient amount needed — after saving, the money reached the required level.

tasks.audioText: The restaurant was not very busy tonight. Only a couple of tables were occupied.
tasks.transcript: Only a couple of tables were occupied.

options.text: Every table in the restaurant was taken.
About half the tables were occupied.
Just two or so tables had customers sitting at them.
The restaurant was closed tonight.

tasks.explanation: 'A couple of' means approximately two — only about two tables were in use.

short_description: Определяем количество: a few, plenty of, enough, too much
